pullRequest.body:
See Zulip discussion at https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/Subgroups.20are.20empty/near/439227685

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body:
It would be nice to see the performance aspects but I don't worry about that (and the server is busy plowing through its backlog anyway). 

I'll wait for a bit for any comments here or on Zulip before summoning bors.
As mentioned on Zulip, this is not an insane instance to have and it seems that there is a Lean bug hiding in that instance never applying.

I don't know if there's a bug or not, but what I know is that this instance is not used anywhere in mathlib. There is a price to all instances, albeit small, since they are often tried in typeclass inference, so having unused instances around looks just bad to me, and I'd rather desactivate them regardless of the Prop-dependent issue.
There is also a price to people expecting an instance to be there when it is not.
@sgouezel Could you please link the relevant Zulip thread in the commit message?
Done.
@YaelDillies , in this case I don't expect anyone would expect this instance given how unusual it is. The fact that it is not used throughout mathlib looks like a good hint in this direction.
I'm pretty sure I use it in LeanCamCombi ü§î
If you give me a convincing pointer, where it's natural to have decidability for some subsets of a given finset but not for all finsets, then I'll close the PR.

What's the status of this PR, @sgouezel?

@mattrobball [wrote](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/Subgroups.20are.20empty/near/439286350):
> Actually, the problems from this instance seem to come from using refine' in place of refine

Did #12997 or #13059 make a difference?

An option to address Yael's concerns somewhat might be to add a sentence to both docstrings explaining why they aren't instances anymore.
The status is that Yael hasn't given me a pointer showing that this instance is useful, so I think the PR is good, and it is awaiting review :-)
!bench

### PR summary [3ede0df920](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/12987/commits/3ede0df92082b5ec57a9a27b7ccbcd291b307e1f)

#### Import changes

No significant changes to the import graph

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh short <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh <optional_commit>
```
</details>

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/84c69154-2b43-431a-a735-7992abf7bb26) for commit 3ede0df92082b5ec57a9a27b7ccbcd291b307e1f.
There were [no significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/277c0dbc-c59c-4dfd-a546-1938d27e5a9b/to/84c69154-2b43-431a-a735-7992abf7bb26) against commit f9caf98dbed0eb3bb593396501ffebe61bda333b.

As far as I can tell, the original issue on Zulip was resolved independently, and while I don't know how to reproduce Matt's tests, it seems that has been addressed, too, and that nothing gained or significantly faster with these instances removed. 
Further, I can not reproduce the comment about he instance never applying, but that might be lack of trying from my side.

If this summary is correct, I don't see much benefit in removing the instances.

(If I missed something I think it would be good to explain here (or on Zulip) what's gained by the change.)

I changed core to toss out errors when it reached a certain edge case in typeclass synthesis. It turned out that certain tactics were at fault, `refine'` and `convert`, rather than instances. 

Generally, I don't think we can live in a world where all instances are available all the time. @fpvandoorn mentioned scoping instances that are used < 10 times. I don't think this instance is ever used (?). Would that be a reasonable solution here?

I don't care tbh, if you're happy to turn it into a `def` and see if anybody will ever complain, I think it's perfectly fine to just merge this and move on :)

Scoping also seems fine.

These instances seem bad to me. I expect Lean will struggle to apply then in cases that `p` is not a variable. 

I think that even if this is useful in LeanCamCombi, we should still (at least) scope these instances. The `-0.454 %` in type-class inference time is probably just noise, but I can also imagine that doing this for 20-50 other instances will actually give a noticeable speed improvement.

I'll let @sgouezel decide if he wants to give @YaelDillies a few more days to give an example, or just to merge it outright.

bors d+

:v: sgouezel can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
I'll wait a few days to see if @YaelDillies has a convincing example, and merge otherwise.
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9739676011/job/26875314526)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9739676011/job/26875314109)
Sorry, I am very busy for another week
Thanks!
Thanks!

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: deactivate Prop-dependent instances

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9739676011/job/26875314526)

Sorry, I am very busy for another week
